ratings.comment: Avoid him if you can, but if not, study hard. I was never confident that what he was teaching us was actually correct because of all the tiny but important mistakes he would make when lecturing. The exams and quizzes weren't crazy difficult but his wording is tricky if you don't read his questions thoroughly.

Definitely not one of the best teachers out there.  I thought I'd prepared pretty decently, had been doing superbly on his quizzes, and then got rocked by his exam. I've attended every lecture and many were not the most helpful. Can't really answer beyond the textbook--if you plan on taking him, I'd say study it over his lectures.
I am about to graduate and Professor Epstein is the worst and unorganized teacher I've had.  He is a smart guy and his knowledge is extensive but he should not be teaching a Zoo 152 course.

Prof. Epstein is NOT the terrible prof described in the these previous posts.  His "scatter" is from ascertaining very complicated particular facts, not general concepts. He follows the book well in comparison to other teachers, so you can look there. Most people are just mad at him because they couldn't ace his exam.  Work hard and you'll do fine.

Pretty much useless. The book will be your best friend. Tries to teach and asks if everyone understands during lecture, but even if no one did he couldn't explain anything to save his life. If you know the material from the book you can probably manage an A on the exam. Relying just on lecture, you'll need divine intervention. Avoid, avoid, avoid.
He was very difficult to understand and wrote ambiguous, poorly worded questions that left you confused.

Scatterbrianed and confused. If you wanted to make sure something was right you had to keep an eye on the class coordinator, if she was shaking her head looking disappointed you knew to delete whatever claptrap the old man was spouting from your memory. Very poorly taught, frighteningly bad questions but definately passable grade-wise.

Worst teacher I've had since I became a student in age of 8. His lectures are confusing. He often gets confused himself. His writings, drawings and ppt are just not understandable to normal ppl. He cannot answer questions above the textbook level. I pay quite a lot of money for good education and that's not what I got in this instructor's lecture.

well i honestly don't think people here rated him fairly. He reverberated what's gonna be on the exam - just get the "big picture" of the biological mechanisms you will be able to get a pretty good grade. I think people have to study what he taught in class and stop ****ing if something goes wrong - you're the person responsible for the grade!

I don't understand all the bad ratings. He was SO EASY! He goes over the same things like 5 times. If you don't understand the material by then, you never will. He is boring but he gets across the main points well. STUDY WHAT HE REPEATS!

One of the worst professors on campus.  He skipped through slides while he rambled and he was obsessed with sodium channels.  He hought the whole class loved him, which kind of made me feel bad for the guy because he is such a bad teacher.  Basically, the zoo 151/152 sequence is a living hell.  If you plan to major in biology, transfer schools.

I realize a lot of the people in this class were discouraged by actually having to "THINK" but in fact this class taught me much more about biology than my peers.  In other words, rats have excellent memories people--if you want to be a human use your head and stop ****ing.

AWEFUL AWEFUL AWEFUL.  He made the human body boring, was unclear, put you to sleep, senile, and his test was ridiculously difficult. Highly discourage taking his section.  However, he is understanding about test grade changes.

Pretty much the worst prof ever! Has virtually no undergrad teaching experience and it shows because he taught like we were 3rd year med students. Test had more ambiguous questions than you could imagine. Highly suggest you don't take him.

Class was a living nightmare!!!  Most of the time he does not seem to know what he is talking about.  He goes so fast and skips a million steps while at it.  Better at teaching the nervous system.  His exams are insane and they don't equally test knowledge of other subjects.  His main focus is the nervous system, expect likewise on the exams.
